Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with an Ollama API to generate responses using HTTP requests through the Guzzle HTTP client.

Class Description: The Ollama class is designed to communicate with an Ollama API endpoint to generate responses based on provided prompts. It handles the configuration of the API request and processes the response.

Attributes:
- model: string - The name of the AI model to be used for generating responses.
- prompt: string - The input text prompt to be sent to the AI model.
- temperature: float - Controls the randomness of the output (higher values make output more random).
- stream: bool - Determines whether the response should be streamed.
- raw: bool - Specifies whether to use raw mode for the prompt processing.

Methods:
- __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw) -> void - Initializes the Ollama instance with the specified parameters for model interaction.
- ask() -> string - Sends a POST request to the Ollama API with the configured parameters and returns the generated response from the AI model.
wrong_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;

class Ollama {
    private $model;
    private $prompt;
    private $temperature;
    private $stream;
    private $raw;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw) {
        $this->model = $model;
        $this->prompt = $prompt;
        $this->temperature = $temperature;
        $this->stream = $stream;
        $this->raw = $raw;
        $this->client = new Client(['base_uri' => 'http://localhost:11434']);
    }

    public function ask(): string {
        $body = [
            'model' => $this->model,
            'prompt' => $this->prompt,
            'options' => ['temperature' => $this->temperature],
            'stream' => $this->stream,
            'raw' => $this->raw
        ];

        $response = $this->client->post('/api/generate', [
            'json' => $body
        ]);

        if ($this->stream) {
            $content = '';
            $stream = $response->getBody()->getContents();
            foreach (explode("\n", $stream) as $line) {
                if (!empty($line)) {
                    $data = json_decode($line, true);
                    $content .= $data['response'] ?? '';
                }
            }
            return $content;
        } else {
            $data = json_decode((string) $response->getBody(), true);
            return $data['response'] ?? '';
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client for sending payment requests to an e-payment API using Guzzle.

Class Description: The EpayHttpClient class is designed to handle HTTP communication with an e-payment API. It encapsulates the functionality for sending payment requests and processing the responses. The class uses Guzzle HTTP client for making requests and handles potential exceptions that may occur during the process.

Attributes:
- epay: array - Stores the configuration for the e-payment API
- client: Client - The Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct(array $epayConfig) -> void - Initializes the class with e-payment configuration and creates a new Guzzle Client instance
- sendPaymentRequest(array $data) -> array - Sends a payment request to the API endpoint and processes the response. Returns an array indicating success/failure and containing either the payment URL or an error message
wrong_result:
<?php
use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\GuzzleException;

class EpayHttpClient {
    private $epay;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(array $epayConfig) {
        $this->epay = $epayConfig;
        $this->client = new Client([
            'base_uri' => $epayConfig['base_url'],
            'timeout' => $epayConfig['timeout'] ?? 10,
        ]);
    }

    public function sendPaymentRequest(array $data): array {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->post('/payments', [
                'json' => $data,
            ]);
            if ($response->getStatusCode() === 200) {
                $responseData = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
                if (isset($responseData['payment_url'])) {
                    return ['success' => true, 'url' => $responseData['payment_url']];
                } else {
                    return ['success' => false, 'error' => 'Invalid response data'];
                }
            } else {
                return ['success' => false, 'error' => 'Unexpected status code: ' . $response->getStatusCode()];
            }
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            return ['success' => false, 'error' => $e->getMessage()];
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxies and basic authentication.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, proxy configuration, timeout settings, and basic authentication. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign content to
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (int, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (int, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content (when 'assign' parameter is used)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Assigns content to the specified template variable and returns nothing if 'assign' parameter is provided
- Returns nothing and triggers notice on error conditions (invalid URL, connection failure)

Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified URL or file path, with support for HTTP requests using fsockopen, including handling of proxy servers, authentication, and security checks.

Function Description: The function retrieves content from either a local file or a remote HTTP resource. For HTTP requests, it establishes a socket connection, sends a GET request with appropriate headers (including authentication if provided), reads the response, and extracts the content body. It includes security checks for trusted URIs and resource directories when operating within a Smarty template context.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string) Required. The URL or file path to fetch
  - 'assign': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign the content to
  - 'assign_headers': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign headers to
  - 'user': (string) Optional. Username for HTTP authentication
  - 'pass': (string) Optional. Password for HTTP authentication
  - 'proxy_host': (string) Optional. Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer) Optional. Proxy server port
- $template: The Smarty template object (used for security checks and variable assignment)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if no 'assign' parameter is provided
- Assigns the content to the specified template variable if 'assign' parameter is present
- Returns nothing if security checks fail or if there are errors in fetching the content

            if ($in_header && trim($line) === '') {
                $in_header = false;
                continue;
            }
            if ($in_header) {
                $headers .= $line;
            } else {

        fclose($fp);

                }

            $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $headers_array);

            $allowed = false;
            foreach ($secure_dirs as $dir) {
                $real_dir = realpath($dir);

                    $allowed = true;
                    break;
                }
            }
            if (!$allowed) return;
        }
        $content = file_get_contents($file);
        if (isset($params['assign'])) {
            $template->assign($params['assign'], $content);
        } else {
            return $content;
        }
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for handling trackback requests using low-level HTTP socket communication.

Class Description: The CI_Trackback class provides functionality to send and process trackback pings to remote servers. It handles HTTP communication directly using fsockopen, processes responses, and manages errors.

Attributes:
- charset: string - Character encoding to use (default: 'UTF-8')
- data: array - Trackback data including url, title, excerpt, blog_name, and charset
- convert_ascii: bool - Whether to convert non-ASCII characters (default: TRUE)
- response: string - Raw HTTP response from the trackback server
- error_msg: array - Collection of error messages encountered during processing

Methods:
- process(string $url, string $data) -> bool - Sends a trackback ping to the specified URL with the given data. Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
  Input: 
    $url: string - Target URL for the trackback
    $data: string - URL-encoded trackback data
  Output: bool - Success status

- get_id(string $url) -> mixed - Extracts a numeric ID from the given URL. Returns the ID as string or FALSE if not found.
  Input: $url: string - URL to parse for an ID
  Output: mixed - Extracted ID string or FALSE

- set_error(string $msg) -> void - Adds an error message to the error collection.
  Input: $msg: string - Error message to store
  Output: void
wrong_result:
<?php
class CI_Trackback {
    public $charset = 'UTF-8';
    public $data = array();
    public $convert_ascii = TRUE;
    public $response = '';
    public $error_msg = array();

    public function process($url, $data) {
        $parsed = parse_url($url);
        if (!$parsed || !isset($parsed['host'])) {
            $this->set_error('Invalid URL');
            return FALSE;
        }

        $host = $parsed['host'];
        $path = isset($parsed['path']) ? $parsed['path'] : '/';
        $port = isset($parsed['port']) ? $parsed['port'] : (isset($parsed['scheme']) && strtolower($parsed['scheme']) === 'https' ? 443 : 80);

        if (isset($parsed['scheme']) && strtolower($parsed['scheme']) === 'https') {
            $this->set_error('HTTPS is not supported');
            return FALSE;
        }

        $fp = @fsockopen('tcp://' . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 10);
        if (!$fp) {
            $this->set_error("Connection failed: $errstr ($errno)");
            return FALSE;
        }

        $request = "POST $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $data;

        fwrite($fp, $request);

        $this->response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $this->response .= fread($fp, 1024);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        $first_line = substr($this->response, 0, strpos($this->response, "\r\n"));
        list(, $status) = explode(' ', $first_line, 3);
        return $status === '200';
    }

    public function get_id($url) {
        $path = parse_url($url, PHP_URL_PATH);
        if ($path === FALSE) {
            return FALSE;
        }
        preg_match_all('/\d+/', $path, $matches);
        return !empty($matches[0]) ? end($matches[0]) : FALSE;
    }

    public function set_error($msg) {
        $this->error_msg[] = $msg;
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that handles HTTP POST requests to Google's reCAPTCHA verification service using low-level socket operations in PHP.

Class Description: ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod is a class that implements reCAPTCHA verification by establishing a direct socket connection to Google's servers, sending an HTTP POST request, and processing the response. It provides an alternative to higher-level HTTP clients.

Attributes:
- socket: [ReCaptchaSocket] - The socket connection handler used for HTTP communication
- RECAPTCHA_HOST: [string] - Constant storing Google's reCAPTCHA hostname ('www.google.com')
- SITE_VERIFY_PATH: [string] - Constant storing the reCAPTCHA verification endpoint path ('/recaptcha/api/siteverify')
- BAD_REQUEST: [string] - Constant JSON response for failed requests
- BAD_RESPONSE: [string] - Constant JSON response for invalid server responses

Methods:
- __construct([ReCaptchaSocket $socket = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the class with an optional socket dependency injection
- submit(ReCaptchaRequestParameters $params) -> [string] - Performs the reCAPTCHA verification by:
  1. Opening an SSL socket connection to Google's server
  2. Formatting and sending an HTTP POST request with verification parameters
  3. Reading and parsing the server response
  4. Returning the verification result as JSON string
  Returns either the server response or error JSON if the request/response fails

Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP/HTTPS communications using either socket-based connections (via fsockopen) or cURL, supporting both standard and persistent connections, with proper header and cookie management.

Class Description: The soap_transport_http class provides low-level HTTP transport capabilities for SOAP communications, supporting both socket and cURL implementations. It handles connection management, request/response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- url: string - The target URL for HTTP requests
- uri: string - The URI portion of the URL
- scheme: string - The protocol scheme (http/https)
- host: string - The target hostname
- port: string - The target port number
- path: string - The path portion of the URL
- request_method: string - HTTP method (default: POST)
- protocol_version: string - HTTP version (default: 1.0)
- outgoing_headers: array - Headers to be sent with the request
- incoming_headers: array - Headers received in the response
- outgoing_payload: string - Data to be sent in the request
- incoming_payload: string - Data received in the response
- persistentConnection: bool - Flag for persistent connections
- use_curl: bool - Flag to use cURL instead of sockets
- proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration if used

Methods:
- __construct(string $url, array $curl_options=null, bool $use_curl=false) -> void - Initializes the transport with target URL and options
- connect(int $connection_timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30) -> bool - Establishes connection to server
- send(string $data, int $timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30, array $cookies=null) -> mixed - Sends data and returns response
- sendRequest(string $data, array $cookies=null) -> bool - Sends the HTTP request with headers
- getResponse() -> string|bool - Reads and processes the server response
- setHeader(string $name, string $value) -> void - Adds a header to outgoing request
- setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value) -> void - Sets cURL option when using cURL
- parseCookie(string $cookie_str) -> array|bool - Parses Set-Cookie header into array
wrong_result:
<?php

class soap_transport_http {
    public $url;
    public $uri;
    public $scheme;
    public $host;
    public $port;
    public $path;
    public $request_method = 'POST';
    public $protocol_version = '1.0';
    public $outgoing_headers = [];
    public $incoming_headers = [];
    public $outgoing_payload;
    public $incoming_payload;
    public $persistentConnection = false;
    public $use_curl;
    public $proxy;

    private $curl_handle;
    private $socket_handle;
    private $curl_options;

    public function __construct($url, $curl_options = null, $use_curl = false) {
        $parsed_url = parse_url($url);
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->scheme = $parsed_url['scheme'] ?? 'http';
        $this->host = $parsed_url['host'];
        $this->port = $parsed_url['port'] ?? ($this->scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $this->path = $parsed_url['path'] ?? '/';
        if (isset($parsed_url['query'])) {
            $this->path .= '?' . $parsed_url['query'];
        }
        $this->uri = $this->path;
        $this->use_curl = $use_curl;
        $this->curl_options = $curl_options ?: [];
        $this->proxy = null;
    }

    public function connect($connection_timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30) {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            $this->curl_handle = curl_init();
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, false);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $response_timeout);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $connection_timeout);
            if ($this->scheme === 'https') {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
            }
            foreach ($this->curl_options as $option => $value) {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, $option, $value);
            }
            if ($this->proxy) {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy['host']);
                if (isset($this->proxy['port'])) {
                    curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXYPORT, $this->proxy['port']);
                }
                if (isset($this->proxy['user'])) {
                    curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $this->proxy['user'] . ':' . $this->proxy['pass']);
                }
            }
            return true;
        } else {
            $context = stream_context_create([
                'ssl' => [
                    'verify_peer' => true,
                    'verify_peer_name' => true,
                ]
            ]);
            $this->socket_handle = @fsockopen(
                $this->scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' . $this->host : $this->host,
                $this->port,
                $errno,
                $errstr,
                $connection_timeout,
                $context
            );
            if (!$this->socket_handle) {
                return false;
            }
            stream_set_timeout($this->socket_handle, $response_timeout);
            return true;
        }
    }

    public function send($data, $timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30, $cookies = null) {
        if (!$this->connect($timeout, $response_timeout)) {
            return false;
        }
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        if (!$this->sendRequest($data, $cookies)) {
            return false;
        }
        return $this->getResponse();
    }

    public function sendRequest($data, $cookies = null) {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->request_method);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            $headers = [];
            foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
                $headers[] = "$name: $value";
            }
            if ($cookies) {
                $headers[] = 'Cookie: ' . http_build_query($cookies, '', '; ', PHP_QUERY_RFC3986);
            }
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
            return true;
        } else {
            $request = "$this->request_method $this->uri HTTP/$this->protocol_version\r\n";
            $request .= "Host: $this->host\r\n";
            if ($this->persistentConnection) {
                $request .= "Connection: Keep-Alive\r\n";
            } else {
                $request .= "Connection: close\r\n";
            }
            foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
                $request .= "$name: $value\r\n";
            }
            if ($cookies) {
                $request .= 'Cookie: ' . http_build_query($cookies, '', '; ', PHP_QUERY_RFC3986) . "\r\n";
            }
            $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($data) . "\r\n";
            $request .= "\r\n";
            $request .= $data;
            fwrite($this->socket_handle, $request);
            return true;
        }
    }

    public function getResponse() {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            $response = curl_exec($this->curl_handle);
            if ($response === false) {
                return false;
            }
            $header_size = curl_getinfo($this->curl_handle, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
            $headers = substr($response, 0, $header_size);
            $body = substr($response, $header_size);
            $this->incoming_headers = [];
            $lines = explode("\r\n", trim($headers));
            foreach ($lines as $line) {
                if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                    list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                    $this->incoming_headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
                }
            }
            $this->incoming_payload = $body;
            return $body;
        } else {
            $response = '';
            while (!feof($this->socket_handle)) {
                $response .= fread($this->socket_handle, 8192);
            }
            $parts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
            if (count($parts) < 2) {
                return false;
            }
            $headers_part = $parts[0];
            $this->incoming_payload = $parts[1];
            $this->incoming_headers = [];
            $lines = explode("\r\n", $headers_part);
            foreach ($lines as $line) {
                if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                    list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                    $this->incoming_headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
                }
            }
            return $this->incoming_payload;
        }
    }

    public function setHeader($name, $value) {
        $this->outgoing_headers[$name] = $value;
    }

    public function setCurlOption($option, $value) {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    public function parseCookie($cookie_str) {
        $cookies = [];
        $parts = explode(';', $cookie_str);
        foreach ($parts as $part) {
            $part = trim($part);
            if (empty($part)) continue;
            if (strpos($part, '=') === false) {
                $cookies[] = $part;
                continue;
            }
            list($key, $value) = explode('=', $part, 2);
            $cookies[trim($key)] = trim($value);
        }
        return $cookies;
    }
}

Instruction:

- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided

    if (!$fp) {
        if (isset($params['assign'])) {
            $template->{$params['assign']} = '';
            return;
        } else {
            return '';
        }
    }
    stream_set_timeout($fp, $timeout);
    $request = $useProxy ? "GET http://$host" . (($port != 80) ? ":$port" : "") . "$fullPath HTTP/1.1\r\n" : "GET $fullPath HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host$portForHost\r\n";
    if ($useProxy) {
        $request .= "Proxy-Connection: close\r\n";
    } else {
        $request .= "Connection: close\r\n";
    }
    $request .= "\r\n";
    fwrite($fp, $request);
    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fread($fp, 4096);
    }
    fclose($fp);
    $pos = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    $body = ($pos !== false) ? substr($response, $pos + 4) : '';
    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        $template->{$params['assign']} = $body;
    } else {
        return $body;
    }
}
?>

Validates file existence, calculates CRC32 checksum, and sends the file with appropriate headers. Returns 0 on success, -1 if file doesn't exist, or -2 if upload fails.

Parameters:

- $storeInfo: array - Contains 'StoreUri' for upload endpoint and 'Auth' for authorization

<?php
class ImageX extends V4Curl {
    public function upload(string $uploadHost, array $storeInfo, string $filePath): int {
        if (!file_exists($filePath) || !is_readable($filePath)) {
            return -1;
        }

        $crc32 = hash_file('crc32b', $filePath);
        $url = $uploadHost . $storeInfo['StoreUri'];

        $headers = [
            'Authorization' => $storeInfo['Auth'],
            'X-CRC32' => $crc32,
            'Content-Type' => mime_content_type($filePath),
        ];

        $client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

        try {
            $response = $client->request('PUT', $url, [
                'headers' => $headers,
                'body' => fopen($filePath, 'r')
            ]);

            if ($response->getStatusCode() >= 200 && $response->getStatusCode() < 300) {
                return 0;
            } else {
                return -2;
            }
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            return -2;
        }
    }
}

<?php

namespace YourNamespace;

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface {
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null) {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $port = $uri->getPort();

        if (!$port) {
            $port = $scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80;
        }

        $requestTarget = $uri->getPath() . ($uri->getQuery() ? '?' . $uri->getQuery() : '');

        $httpVersion = $request->getProtocolVersion();
        $method = $request->getMethod();

        $requestLine = "$method $requestTarget HTTP/$httpVersion\r\n";

        $headers = [];

        $hasHostHeader = false;
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            if (strtolower($name) === 'host') {
                $hasHostHeader = true;
                break;
            }
        }

        if (!$hasHostHeader) {
            $headers[] = "Host: $host";
        }

        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                $headers[] = "$name: $value";
            }
        }

        $body = (string) $request->getBody();
        $contentLength = strlen($body);

        $hasContentLength = false;
        foreach ($request->getHeaders() as $name => $values) {
            if (strtolower($name) === 'content-length') {
                $hasContentLength = true;
                break;
            }
        }

        if (!$hasContentLength) {
            $headers[] = "Content-Length: $contentLength";
        }

        $fullRequest = $requestLine . implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n";

        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->debug('Sending HTTP request: ' . $requestLine . implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n");
        }

        $fullRequest .= $body;

        $errno = 0;
        $errstr = '';
        $context = null;

        if ($scheme === 'https') {
            $context = stream_context_create([
                'ssl' => [
                    'verify_peer' => true,
                    'verify_peer_name' => true,
                    'SNI_server_name' => $host,
                ]
            ]);
        }

        $wrapper = $scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : 'tcp://';
        $fp = stream_socket_client(
            "$wrapper$host:$port",
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            30,
            STREAM_CLIENT_CONNECT,
            $context
        );

        if (!$fp) {
            if ($this->logger) {
                $this->logger->error("Connection failed: $errstr (errno: $errno)");
            }
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: $errstr (errno: $errno)");
        }

        fwrite($fp, $fullRequest);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fread($fp, 1024);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        $statusLine = substr($response, 0, strpos($response, "\r\n"));
        $remaining = substr($response, strlen($statusLine) + 2);

        preg_match('/HTTP\/1\.(\d) (\d{3}) (.*)/', $statusLine, $matches);
        $httpVersion = '1.' . $matches[1];
        $statusCode = (int)$matches[2];
        $reasonPhrase = $matches[3];

        $headersBlockEnd = strpos($remaining, "\r\n\r\n");
        $headersBlock = substr($remaining, 0, $headersBlockEnd);
        $body = substr($remaining, $headersBlockEnd + 4);

        $parsedHeaders = [];
        foreach (explode("\r\n", $headersBlock) as $headerLine) {
            if (empty($headerLine)) {
                continue;
            }
            list($name, $value) = explode(':', $headerLine, 2);
            $name = trim($name);
            $value = trim($value);
            $parsedHeaders[$name][] = $value;
        }

        $responseStream = \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Utils::streamFor($body);
        return new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response($statusCode, $parsedHeaders, $responseStream, $httpVersion, $reasonPhrase);
    }
}

<?php

class RabbitMQConsumer {
    private $msgCount = 0;
    private $startTime = null;
    private $conn;
    private $ch;
    private $exchange = 'my_exchange';
    private $queue = 'my_queue';
    private $consumer_tag = '';
    private $shutdown = false;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->conn = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();
        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange, '');
    }

    public function process_message(AMQPMessage $msg) {
        $this->msgCount++;
        if ($this->startTime === null) {
            $this->startTime = microtime(true);
        }
        echo "Received message: " . $msg->body . PHP_EOL;
        $msg->delivery_info['channel']->basic_ack($msg->delivery_info['delivery_tag']);
    }

    public function startConsuming() {
        declare(ticks=1);
        pcntl_signal(SIGTERM, array($this, 'handleSignal'));
        pcntl_signal(SIGINT, array($this, 'handleSignal'));

        $this->ch->basic_consume($this->queue, $this->consumer_tag, false, false, false, false, array($this, 'process_message'));

        while (count($this->ch->callbacks)) {
            if ($this->shutdown) {
                break;
            }
            $this->ch->wait();
        }

        $this->shutdown();
    }

    public function handleSignal($signo) {
        $this->shutdown = true;
    }

    public function shutdown() {
        if ($this->ch !== null) {
            $this->ch->close();
        }
        if ($this->conn !== null) {
            $this->conn->close();
        }
    }
}

function consumeMessages($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    $connection = new AMQPConnection();

    $connection->setPort($port);
    $connection->setLogin($user);
    $connection->setPassword($pass);
    $connection->setVhost($vhost);
    if (!$connection->connect()) {
        die("Couldn't connect to RabbitMQ");
    }

    $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

    $amqpExchange = new AMQPExchange($channel);
    $amqpExchange->setName($exchange);
    $amqpExchange->setType(AMQP_EX_TYPE_DIRECT);
    $amqpExchange->declare();

            if ($body === 'good') {

        }
    );

    $amqpQueue->consume();

    $channel->close();
    $connection->disconnect();
}

<?php

namespace App\Validation\Rules;

use Illuminate\Contracts\Validation\Rule;

class Captcha implements Rule
{
    public function passes($attribute, $value): bool
    {
        if (empty($value)) {
            return false;
        }

        $secret = config('services.recaptcha.secret');
        $ip = request()->ip();

        $data = [
            'secret' => $secret,
            'response' => $value,
            'remoteip' => $ip,
        ];

        $context = stream_context_create([
            'http' => [
                'method' => 'POST',
                'header' => 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
                'content' => http_build_query($data),
            ],
        ]);

        $response = file_get_contents('https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api/siteverify', false, $context);
        $result = json_decode($response, true);

        return $result['success'] ?? false;
    }

    public function message(): string
    {
        return __('validation.captcha');
    }
}

<?php

function publishMessages($msg_count, $batch_size, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost) {
    $start = microtime(true);

    $connection = new AMQPConnection();
    $connection->setHost($host);
    $connection->setPort($port);
    $connection->setLogin($user);
    $connection->setPassword($pass);
    $connection->setVhost($vhost);
    $connection->connect();

    $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

    $exchange = new AMQPExchange($channel);
    $exchange->setName('batch_exchange');
    $exchange->setType(AMQP_EX_TYPE_DIRECT);
    $exchange->declare();

    $queue = new AMQPQueue($channel);
    $queue->setName('batch_queue');
    $queue->declare();
    $queue->bind('batch_exchange', 'batch_queue');

    for ($i = 0; $i < $msg_count; $i += $batch_size) {
        $currentBatchSize = min($batch_size, $msg_count - $i);
        for ($j = 0; $j < $currentBatchSize; $j++) {
            $msgIndex = $i + $j;
            $msgBody = "Message $msgIndex";
            $exchange->publish($msgBody, 'batch_queue');
        }
    }

    $exchange->publish('quit', 'batch_queue');

    $channel->close();
    $connection->disconnect();

    $end = microtime(true);
    return $end - $start;
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a Redis-based queue management system with connection handling, basic Redis operations, and error recovery mechanisms.

Class Description: The `queue` class is a Redis wrapper that manages connections to Redis servers and provides common Redis operations with automatic reconnection on failure. It supports multiple Redis connections, connection pooling, and prefixing of keys.

Attributes:
- `$redis`: [static, mixed] - Placeholder for Redis instance (deprecated in favor of `$links`)
- `$configs`: [static, array] - Stores configuration for different Redis connections
- `$links`: [static, array] - Maintains active Redis connections
- `$link_name`: [static, string] - Current connection name (defaults to 'default')
- `$prefix`: [static, string] - Default prefix for Redis keys
- `$error`: [static, string] - Stores the last error message

Methods:
- `init()` -> [bool|Redis] - Initializes Redis connection using current configuration. Returns Redis instance or false on failure.
- `set($key, $value, $expire = 0)` -> [bool|null] - Sets a key-value pair in Redis with optional expiration. Returns true on success, null on failure.
- `get($key)` -> [mixed|null] - Retrieves a value by key from Redis. Returns the value or null on failure.
- `del($key)` -> [int|null] - Deletes a key from Redis. Returns number of deleted keys or null on failure.
- `_get_default_config()` -> [array] - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings.
- `clear_link()` -> [void] - Closes all active Redis connections and clears the connection pool.

Input:
- Configuration via `$GLOBALS['config']['redis']` for default connection
- Method parameters as described above

Output:
- For connection methods: Redis instance or boolean
- For data operations: Various return types as described above
- Error messages stored in `$error` property

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a Redis client connection using TCP sockets and the phpiredis extension for efficient communication with a Redis server.

Class Description: PhpiredisSocketConnection is a Redis client connection class that handles TCP socket communication with a Redis server. It manages socket creation, connection, data transmission, and response parsing using the phpiredis extension for optimal performance.

Attributes:
- reader: [resource] - The phpiredis reader resource used for parsing Redis protocol responses
- parameters: [ParametersInterface] - Connection parameters including host, port, timeout, etc.

Methods:
- __construct(ParametersInterface $parameters) -> [void] - Initializes the connection and verifies required extensions
- __destruct() -> [void] - Cleans up resources when the object is destroyed
- assertExtensions() -> [void] - Verifies required PHP extensions are loaded
- createReader() -> [resource] - Creates and configures a phpiredis reader resource
- getStatusHandler() -> [callable] - Returns the handler for status responses
- getErrorHandler() -> [callable] - Returns the handler for error responses
- createResource() -> [resource] - Creates and connects the socket resource
- connectWithTimeout(resource $socket, string $address, ParametersInterface $parameters) -> [void] - Establishes connection with timeout handling
- write(string $buffer) -> [void] - Writes data to the socket connection
- read() -> [mixed] - Reads and parses response from the server
- writeRequest(CommandInterface $command) -> [void] - Formats and writes a Redis command to the server

Task Description: Implement a Radius class in PHP that handles RADIUS protocol communication for authentication and accounting purposes using UDP sockets.

    public function AccessRequest($username = '', $password = '', $udp_timeout = 0, $state = NULL) {
        if ($username === '') {
            $username = $this->_username;
        }
        if ($password === '') {
            $password = $this->_password;
        }
        if ($udp_timeout > 0) {
            $this->_udp_timeout = $udp_timeout;
        }

        $this->_identifier_to_send = $this->GetNextIdentifier();
        $this->GenerateRequestAuthenticator();
        $this->_radius_packet_to_send = self::RADIUS_CODE_ACCESS_REQUEST;
        $this->SetUsername($username);
        $this->SetPassword($password);
        
        if ($this->_shared_secret === '') {
            $this->SetLastError(1, "Shared secret not set");
            return false;
        }
        
        $this->SetAttribute(1, $this->_username . $this->_radius_suffix);
        $this->SetAttribute(2, $this->_password);
        $this->SetAttribute(4, $this->_nas_ip_address);
        $this->SetAttribute(5, $this->_nas_port);
        
        $socket = $this->_OpenSocket($udp_timeout);
        if (!$socket) {
            return false;
        }
        
        $packet = $this->_BuildPacket($this->_radius_packet_to_send, $this->_identifier_to_send);
        if ($packet === false) {
            return false;
        }
        
        $port = $this->_authentication_port;
        $sent = @socket_sendto($socket, $packet, strlen($packet), 0, $this->_ip_radius_server, $port);
        if ($sent === false) {
            $this->SetLastError(2, "Failed to send packet to RADIUS server");
            socket_close($socket);
            return false;
        }
        
        $response = '';
        $recv_port = 0;
        $timeout = microtime(true) + $this->_udp_timeout;
        while (microtime(true) < $timeout) {
            $read = [$socket];
            $write = null;
            $except = null;
            $tv_sec = 0;
            $tv_usec = 500000;
            $select_result = @socket_select($read, $write, $except, $tv_sec, $tv_usec);

                continue;

                break;
            }
        }
        
        socket_close($socket);
        
        if (strlen($response) < 20) {
            $this->SetLastError(3, "Invalid response from RADIUS server");
            return false;
        }
        
        $this->_radius_packet_received = ord($response[0]);
        $this->_identifier_received = ord($response[1]);
        
        if ($this->_identifier_received !== $this->_identifier_to_send) {
            $this->SetLastError(4, "Packet identifier mismatch");

        while ($offset < strlen($response)) {
            $attribute_type = ord($response[$offset]);
            $attribute_length = ord($response[$offset + 1]);
            if ($attribute_length < 2 || $offset + $attribute_length > strlen($response)) {
                break;
            }
            $attribute_value = substr($response, $offset + 2, $attribute_length - 2);
            $this->_attributes_received[] = [
                'type' => $attribute_type,
                'value' => $this->DecodeAttribute($attribute_value, $attribute_type)
            ];
            $offset += $attribute_length;
        }
        
        if ($this->_radius_packet_received === self::RADIUS_CODE_ACCESS_ACCEPT) {
            return true;
        } elseif ($this->_radius_packet_received === self::RADIUS_CODE_ACCESS_REJECT) {
            $this->SetLastError(5, "Access rejected by RADIUS server");
            return false;
        } else {
            $this->SetLastError(6, "Unexpected RADIUS response code: " . $this->_radius_packet_received);
            return false;
        }
    }

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a UDP scraper class for interacting with BitTorrent trackers to scrape torrent statistics using UDP protocol.

Class Description: UdpScraper is a class that handles communication with BitTorrent trackers via UDP protocol to retrieve scrape information (seeders, leechers, downloads) for given torrent info hashes. It manages socket connections, transaction IDs, and packet formatting according to the UDP tracker protocol.

Attributes:
- currentConnectionId: [string] - The connection ID received from the tracker after initial connection
- transactionId: [int] - The current transaction ID used for request/response tracking
- socket: [resource|null] - The UDP socket resource for communication
- timeout: [int] - Socket timeout in seconds for send/receive operations

Methods:
- scrape([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Main method to scrape multiple torrent hashes by splitting them into chunks
- scrapeChunk([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Scrapes a chunk of torrent hashes (max 74 at a time)
- initSocket() -> [resource] - Initializes and returns a UDP socket
- connect([string $domain, int $port]) -> [void] - Connects the socket to the tracker
- generateTransactionId() -> [void] - Generates a random transaction ID
- startTransaction() -> [void] - Initiates connection with the tracker and establishes connection ID
- scrapeHashes([array $hashes]) -> [array] - Sends scrape request for given hashes and processes response
- request([string $packet, int $readLength]) -> [string] - Sends packet and reads response with timeout
- closeSocket() -> [void] - Closes the socket and resets connection state
- checkError([string $response]) -> [void] - Checks for and handles error responses from tracker

Task Description: Create a MySQL proxy class that handles communication between a client and MySQL server using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP/UDP communication, implementing authentication and packet handling.

Class Description: MysqlProxy - A class that manages MySQL protocol communication between client and server, handling connection establishment, authentication, packet processing, and error handling.

Attributes:

isDuplex: [bool] - Indicates whether duplex communication is supported by Swoole version
server: [swoole_server] - Swoole server instance
serverFd: [int] - File descriptor of the server connection
charset: [string] - Character set for MySQL communication
account: [array] - MySQL account credentials
auth: [bool] - Authentication status flag
chan: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Coroutine channel for communication
serverPublicKey: [string] - Server's public key for authentication
salt: [array] - Salt used for password encryption
connected: [bool] - Connection status flag
timeout: [float] - Connection timeout value
mysqlClient: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Channel for MySQL client communication
mysqlServer: [HandshakePacket] - Server handshake information
client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - Coroutine client instance

Methods:

__construct: [function](swoole_server $server, int $fd, Swoole\Coroutine\Channel $chan) -> [void] - Initializes the proxy with server, file descriptor and channel
connect: [function](string $host, int $port, float $timeout = 0.1, int $tryStep = 0) -> [Client|bool] - Establishes connection to MySQL server with retry logic
onClientReceive: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli, string $data) -> [void] - Handles incoming data from MySQL server
processAuth: [function](string $pluginName) -> [array] - Processes authentication based on plugin type
send: [function](...$data) -> [bool] - Sends data to MySQL server
recv: [function](&$remain) -> [mixed] - Receives data from MySQL server
onClientClose: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client connection closure
onClientError: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client errors

<?php

class MysqlProxy {
    public $isDuplex;
    public $server;
    public $serverFd;
    public $charset = 'utf8mb4';
    public $account = [];
    public $auth = false;
    public $chan;
    public $serverPublicKey;
    public $salt = [];
    public $connected = false;
    public $timeout = 0.1;
    public $mysqlClient;
    public $mysqlServer;
    public $client;

    public function __construct($server, $fd, $chan) {
        $this->server = $server;
        $this->serverFd = $fd;
        $this->chan = $chan;
        $this->isDuplex = class_exists('Swoole\Coroutine\Client') && method_exists('Swoole\Coroutine\Client', 'set');
    }

    public function connect($host, $port, $timeout = 0.1, $tryStep = 0) {
        $maxRetries = 3;
        while ($tryStep < $maxRetries) {
            $this->client = new Swoole\Coroutine\Client(SWOOLE_SOCK_TCP);
            $this->client->set([
                'open_length_check' => true,
                'package_max_length' => 16 * 1024 * 1024,
                'package_length_type' => 'V',
                'package_length_offset' => 0,
                'package_body_offset' => 3,
                'check_packet_header' => true,
            ]);
            if ($this->client->connect($host, $port, $timeout)) {
                $this->connected = true;
                $this->client->on('receive', [$this, 'onClientReceive']);
                $this->client->on('close', [$this, 'onClientClose']);
                $this->client->on('error', [$this, 'onClientError']);
                return $this->client;
            }
            $tryStep++;
            co::sleep(0.1 * $tryStep);
        }
        return false;
    }

    public function onClientReceive($cli, $data) {
        if ($this->chan->isBuffering()) {
            $this->chan->push($data);
        } else {
            $this->server->send($this->serverFd, $data);
        }
    }

    public function processAuth($pluginName) {
        $authData = ['auth' => ''];
        if ($pluginName === 'mysql_native_password') {
            $scramble = $this->salt[0] . $this->salt[1];
            $authData['auth'] = \Swoole\Coroutine\System::exec("mysql_old_password {$this->account['password']} {$scramble}");
        } elseif ($pluginName === 'caching_sha2_password') {
            $authData['auth'] = \Swoole\Coroutine\System::exec("mysql_clear_password {$this->account['password']}");
        }
        return $authData;
    }

    public function send(...$data) {
        if (!$this->connected) return false;
        return $this->client->send(implode('', $data));
    }

    public function recv(&$remain) {
        if (strlen($remain) < 3) {
            $pkt = $this->client->recv(3 - strlen($remain));
            if ($pkt === false) return false;
            $remain .= $pkt;
        }
        $length = unpack('V', $remain)[1] & 0x00FFFFFF;
        $total = 3 + $length;
        while (strlen($remain) < $total) {
            $pkt = $this->client->recv($total - strlen($remain));
            if ($pkt === false) return false;
            $remain .= $pkt;
        }
        $packet = substr($remain, 3, $length);
        $remain = substr($remain, $total);
        return $packet;
    }

    public function onClientClose($cli) {
        $this->connected = false;
        $this->server->close($this->serverFd);
    }

    public function onClientError($cli) {
        $this->connected = false;
        $this->server->close($this->serverFd);
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a JSON-RPC client using Swoole's coroutine-based TCP client for asynchronous communication with a JSON-RPC server. The class should handle connection management, request/response serialization, and middleware processing.

Class Description: The Connection class provides a JSON-RPC client implementation using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP communication. It manages the connection lifecycle, handles JSON-RPC protocol serialization/deserialization, and supports middleware processing for requests.

Attributes:
- host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the JSON-RPC server
- port: [int] - The port number of the JSON-RPC server
- timeout: [float] - Connection timeout in seconds
- callTimeout: [float] - Timeout for RPC calls in seconds
- middleware: [array] - Array of middleware objects to process requests
- client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - The Swoole coroutine client instance (protected)

Methods:
- __construct([array $config = []]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the connection with optional configuration
- connect() -> [void] - Establishes a TCP connection to the JSON-RPC server
- call([Request $request]) -> [Response] - Sends a JSON-RPC request and returns the response, processing through middleware
- close() -> [void] - Closes the connection to the server
- recv([float $timeout = -1]) -> [string] - Receives data from the server with optional timeout (protected)
- send([string $data]) -> [void] - Sends data to the server (protected)

<?php

class Connection
{
    protected $host;
    protected $port;
    protected $timeout;
    protected $callTimeout;
    protected $middleware = [];
    protected $client;

    public function __construct(array $config = [])
    {
        $default = [
            'host' => '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => 8080,
            'timeout' => 5.0,
            'callTimeout' => 10.0,
            'middleware' => [],
        ];
        $config = array_merge($default, $config);
        $this->host = $config['host'];
        $this->port = $config['port'];
        $this->timeout = $config['timeout'];
        $this->callTimeout = $config['callTimeout'];
        $this->middleware = $config['middleware'];
    }

    public function connect()
    {
        $this->client = new \Swoole\Coroutine\Client(SWOOLE_SOCK_TCP);
        $this->client->set([
            'package_eof' => "\n",
            'socket_buffer_size' => 1024 * 1024 * 4,
        ]);
        if (!$this->client->connect($this->host, $this->port, $this->timeout)) {
            throw new \Exception("Connection failed to {$this->host}:{$this->port}");
        }
    }

    public function call(\JsonRpc\Request $request): \JsonRpc\Response
    {
        foreach ($this->middleware as $middleware) {
            $request = $middleware->process($request);
        }

        $json = json_encode($request->toArray());
        $this->send($json);

        $response = $this->recv($this->callTimeout);
        if ($response === false) {
            throw new \Exception("Receive timeout after {$this->callTimeout}s");
        }

        $data = json_decode($response, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            throw new \Exception("Invalid JSON response: $response");
        }

        return new \JsonRpc\Response($data);
    }

    public function close()
    {
        if ($this->client && $this->client->isConnected()) {
            $this->client->close();
        }
    }

    protected function recv(float $timeout = -1): string
    {
        $result = $this->client->recv($timeout);
        if ($result === false) {
            $this->client->close();
            throw new \Exception("Receive failed: " . \Swoole\Coroutine\Client::_strerror($this->client->errCode));
        }
        return trim($result);
    }

    protected function send(string $data)
    {
        if (!$this->client->send($data . "\n")) {
            $this->client->close();
            throw new \Exception("Send failed: " . \Swoole\Coroutine\Client::strerror($this->client->errCode));
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages a subprocess using proc_open, providing methods to initialize, communicate with, and terminate the process, while handling errors and resource cleanup.

Class Description: The ProcessStream class manages a subprocess execution through pipes for stdin, stdout, and stderr communication. It handles process initialization, error checking, and proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- command: string - The command to be executed in the subprocess
- stream: resource - The process resource created by proc_open
- in: resource - The stdin pipe for writing to the subprocess
- out: resource - The stdout pipe for reading from the subprocess

Methods:
- setCommand(string $command) -> void - Sets the command to be executed by the subprocess
- initialize() -> void - Starts the subprocess, sets up communication pipes, and checks for startup errors
- terminate() -> void - Closes all pipes and terminates the subprocess
- getReadConnectionDescription() -> string - Returns a description of the process connection (for logging/debugging)

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages subprocess execution using proc_open, handling input/output through pipes, with support for timeouts and temporary files.

Class Description: The DefaultPhpProcess class provides functionality to execute subprocesses in PHP using proc_open, managing standard input/output/error streams through pipes. It supports timeout handling, environment variable configuration, and temporary file usage for large inputs.

Attributes:
- tempFile: [string|null] - Path to temporary file used for storing input when needed
- stdin: [string|null] - Standard input content for the subprocess
- env: [array|null] - Environment variables to pass to the subprocess
- timeout: [int|null] - Maximum execution time in seconds before terminating the subprocess

Methods:
- runJob(string $job, array $settings = []): array - Executes a job with optional settings, returns output
  Input: 
    - $job: [string] - The input content for the subprocess
    - $settings: [array] - Additional execution settings
  Output: [array] - Associative array containing 'stdout' and 'stderr' output

- getHandles(): array - Returns additional stream handles for the subprocess
  Output: [array] - Array of stream handles

- runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array - Internal method to execute the subprocess
  Input:
    - $job: [string] - The input content
    - $settings: [array] - Execution settings
  Output: [array] - Associative array containing 'stdout' and 'stderr'

- process(resource $pipe, string $job): void - Writes job content to the input pipe
  Input:
    - $pipe: [resource] - The input pipe resource
    - $job: [string] - Content to write

- cleanup(): void - Cleans up temporary resources (files)
  
- useTemporaryFile(): bool - Determines whether to use temporary files for input
  Output: [bool] - True if temporary files should be used

    protected function runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array {
        $command = $settings['command'];
        $env = $this->env !== null ? $this->env : [];
        $cwd = $settings['cwd'] ?? getcwd();

        $descriptorspec = $this->getHandles();
        $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes, $cwd, $env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            return ['stdout' => '', 'stderr' => 'Failed to start process'];
        }

        if (!$this->useTemporaryFile()) {
            $this->process($pipes[0], $job);
        }

        $stdout = '';
        $stderr = '';
        $startTime = microtime(true);
        $timeoutReached = false;

        if (isset($pipes[1])) {
            stream_set_blocking($pipes[1], 0);
        }
        if (isset($pipes[2])) {
            stream_set_blocking($pipes[2], 0);
        }

        while (true) {
            $status = proc_get_status($process);
            if (!$status['running']) {
                break;
            }

            $elapsed = microtime(true) - $startTime;
            if ($this->timeout !== null && $elapsed > $this->timeout) {
                proc_terminate($process, 9);
                $timeoutReached = true;
                break;
            }

            if (isset($pipes[1])) {
                while ($data = fread($pipes[1], 8192)) {
                    $stdout .= $data;
                }
            }

            if (isset($pipes[2])) {
                while ($data = fread($pipes[2], 8192)) {
                    $stderr .= $data;
                }
            }

            usleep(10000);
        }

        if (isset($pipes[1])) {
            while ($data = fread($pipes[1], 8192)) {
                $stdout .= $data;
            }
        }
        if (isset($pipes[2])) {
            while ($data = fread($pipes[2], 8192)) {
                $stderr .= $data;
            }
        }

        foreach ($pipes as $pipe) {
            fclose($pipe);
        }
        proc_close($process);

        return ['stdout' => $stdout, 'stderr' => $stderr];
    }

    protected function process($pipe, string $job): void {
        fwrite($pipe, $job);
        fclose($pipe);
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if ($this->tempFile !== null && file_exists($this->tempFile)) {
            unlink($this->tempFile);
            $this->tempFile = null;
        }
    }

    protected function useTemporaryFile(): bool {
        return $this->stdin !== null && strlen($this->stdin) > 1024;
    }
}

Class Description: ProcessHandler is a logging handler that executes a subprocess and communicates with it through pipes (stdin, stdout, stderr). It ensures proper process management, handles startup errors, and provides methods for writing input and reading errors.

- write(LogRecord $record) -> [void] - Writes formatted log record to the process stdin
- close() -> [void] - Closes all pipes and terminates the process
- ensureProcessIsStarted() -> [void] - Ensures the subprocess is running (starts if not)
- startProcess() -> [void] - Starts the subprocess using proc_open
- handleStartupErrors() -> [void] - Checks for and handles any startup errors
- selectErrorStream() -> [int|false] - Monitors the stderr pipe for activity

<?php

namespace Your\Namespace;

use Monolog\Handler\AbstractHandler;
use Monolog\Level;
use Monolog\LogRecord;

class ProcessHandler extends AbstractHandler
{
    protected $process;
    protected $command;
    protected $cwd;
    protected $pipes;

    public function __construct(string $command, Level $level = Level::Debug, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null)
    {
        parent::__construct($level, $bubble);
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
    }

    public function write(LogRecord $record): void
    {
        $this->ensureProcessIsStarted();
        $this->writeProcessInput($record->formatted);
    }

    protected function ensureProcessIsStarted(): void
    {
        if (!$this->process) {
            $this->startProcess();
            $this->handleStartupErrors();
        }
    }

    protected function startProcess(): void
    {
        $descriptorspec = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        ];

        $this->pipes = [];
        $this->process = proc_open($this->command, $descriptorspec, $this->pipes, $this->cwd);

        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('Failed to start subprocess: ' . $this->command);
        }
    }

    protected function handleStartupErrors(): void
    {
        while ($this->selectErrorStream() > 0) {
            $error = $this->readProcessErrors();
            if ($error) {
                trigger_error('Subprocess error: ' . $error, E_USER_WARNING);
            }
        }
    }

    protected function selectErrorStream(): int|false
    {
        $read = [$this->pipes[2]];
        $write = [];
        $except = [];

        return stream_select($read, $write, $except, 0, 0);
    }

    protected function readProcessErrors(): string
    {
        $error = '';
        while ($line = fgets($this->pipes[2], 1024)) {
            $error .= $line;
        }
        return $error;
    }

    protected function writeProcessInput(string $string): void
    {
        fwrite($this->pipes[0], $string);
    }

    public function close(): void
    {
        if (is_resource($this->process)) {
            proc_terminate($this->process);
            foreach ($this->pipes as $pipe) {
                fclose($pipe);
            }
            $this->process = null;
            $this->pipes = [];
        }
    }
}

<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class HttpClient {
    private $client;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->client = new Client([
            'defaults' => [
                'headers' => [
                    'User-Agent' => 'HttpClient/1.0',
                ],
                'timeout' => 10,
            ],
        ]);
    }

    public function getSourceFile(string $fileName, string $savePath, string $url): bool {
        try {
            $fullPath = $savePath . '/' . $fileName;
            $this->client->get($url, ['sink' => $fullPath]);
            return true;
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function getLatestReleaseTagName(string $repo): string {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get("https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases?per_page=100");
            $releases = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
            foreach ($releases as $release) {
                if (!$release['prerelease']) {
                    return $release['tag_name'];
                }
            }
            return '';
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return '';
        }
    }

    public function getLatestPreReleaseTagName(string $repo): string {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get("https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases?per_page=100");

            foreach ($releases as $release) {
                if ($release['prerelease']) {
                    return $release['tag_name'];
                }
            }
            return '';
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return '';
        }
    }
}

        }
        $this->response_body .= $data;
        return $written;

    public function prep_request() {
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_URL, $this->request_url);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 10);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $this->useragent);

        if ($this->username && $this->password) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERPWD, $this->username . ':' . $this->password);
        }

        if ($this->proxy) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy['url']);
        }

        if (!$this->ssl_verification) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        } else if ($this->cacert_location) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CAINFO, $this->cacert_location);
        }

        $headers = [];
        foreach ($this->request_headers as $key => $value) {
            $headers[] = $key . ': ' . $value;
        }
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);

        if (in_array($this->method, ['POST', 'PUT'])) {
            if ($this->read_stream || $this->read_file) {
                if ($this->read_file) {
                    $this->read_stream = fopen($this->read_file, 'r');
                    if ($this->read_stream_size === null) {
                        $this->read_stream_size = filesize($this->read_file);
                    }
                }
                if ($this->seek_position !== null) {
                    fseek($this->read_stream, $this->seek_position);
                }
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILE, $this->read_stream);
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILESIZE, $this->read_stream_size);
            } else {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->request_body);
            }
        }

        if ($this->registered_streaming_read_callback) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_READFUNCTION, $this->registered_streaming_read_callback);
        } else if ($this->read_stream || $this->read_file) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_READFUNCTION, [$this, 'streaming_read_callback']);
        }

        if ($this->registered_streaming_write_callback) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, $this->registered_streaming_write_callback);
        } else if ($this->write_file) {
            $this->write_stream = fopen($this->write_file, 'w');
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_FILE, $this->write_stream);
        }

        if ($this->method === 'POST') {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        } elseif ($this->method !== 'GET') {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->method);
        }

        if ($this->curlopts) {
            foreach ($this->curlopts as $key => $value) {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, $key, $value);
            }
        }

        return $this->curl_handle;
    }

    public function process_response($curl_handle, $response) {
        $this->response = $response;
        $header_size = curl_getinfo($this->curl_handle, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $this->response_headers_raw = substr($this->response, 0, $header_size);
        $this->response_body = substr($this->response, $header_size);
        $this->parse_response_headers();
        $this->response_info = curl_getinfo($this->curl_handle);
        $this->response_code = $this->response_info['http_code'];
        return $this->response_body;
    }

    public function send_request($parse = false) {
        $this->prep_request();
        $response = curl_exec($this->curl_handle);
        $this->process_response($this->curl_handle, $response);
        return $parse ? $this->response_body : $response;
    }

    public function get_response_header($header = null) {
        if ($header) {
            return $this->response_headers[$header] ?? null;
        }
        return $this->response_headers;
    }

    public function get_response_body() {
        return $this->response_body;
    }

    public function get_response_code() {
        return $this->response_code;
    }

    private function parse_response_headers() {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $this->response_headers_raw);
        if (!empty($lines)) {
            $status_line = array_shift($lines);
            if (preg_match('/\s*(\d{3})\s*/', $status_line, $matches)) {
                $this->response_code = (int)$matches[1];
            }
        }
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (empty($line)) continue;
            list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
            $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
        }
        $this->response_headers = $headers;
    }
}

<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class FetchConversionRate
{
    private int $baseCurrencyId;

    public function __construct(int $baseCurrencyId)
    {
        $this->baseCurrencyId = $baseCurrencyId;
    }

    public function handle(CurrencyRepository $currencyRepository, ConversionRateRepository $conversionRateRepository): void
    {
        $baseCurrency = $currencyRepository->find($this->baseCurrencyId);
        if (!$baseCurrency) {
            return;
        }

        $baseCode = $baseCurrency->getCode();
        $allCurrencies = $currencyRepository->findAll();
        $client = new Client();

        foreach ($allCurrencies as $targetCurrency) {
            if ($targetCurrency->getId() === $this->baseCurrencyId) {
                continue;
            }

            $targetCode = $targetCurrency->getCode();

            try {
                $response = $client->get("https://api.example.com/rates/{$baseCode}/{$targetCode}");
                $data = json_decode((string) $response->getBody(), true);
                $rate = $data['rate'] ?? null;

                if ($rate === null) {
                    continue;
                }

                $existingRate = $conversionRateRepository->findOneBy([
                    'base_currency_id' => $this->baseCurrencyId,
                    'target_currency_id' => $targetCurrency->getId(),
                ]);

                if ($existingRate) {
                    $existingRate->setRate($rate);
                    $conversionRateRepository->update($existingRate);
                } else {
                    $conversionRate = new ConversionRate();
                    $conversionRate->setBaseCurrencyId($this->baseCurrencyId);
                    $conversionRate->setTargetCurrencyId($targetCurrency->getId());
                    $conversionRate->setRate($rate);
                    $conversionRateRepository->save($conversionRate);
                }
            } catch (RequestException $e) {
                continue;
            }
        }
    }
}

<?php

abstract class SupportedApps {
    protected $client;
    protected $jar;
    protected $method = 'GET';
    protected $error = null;

    public function __construct($jar = false) {
        $this->jar = $jar;
        $this->client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client([
            'cookies' => $this->jar,
            'timeout' => 10.0
        ]);
    }

    public function execute($url, array $attrs = [], $overridevars = null, $overridemethod = null) {
        try {
            $options = $attrs;
            if ($overridevars !== null) {
                $options = array_merge($options, $overridevars);
            }
            $options['http_errors'] = false;
            $method = $overridemethod !== null ? $overridemethod : $this->method;
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $url, $options);
            return $response;
        } catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\ConnectException $e) {
            $this->error = 'Connection error: ' . $e->getMessage();
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            $this->error = 'Error: ' . $e->getMessage();
        }
        return null;
    }

    public function appTest($url, array $attrs = []) {
        $result = (object) [
            'status_code' => 0,
            'status_message' => 'Unknown error',
            'response' => null,
        ];

        $response = $this->execute($url, $attrs);
        if ($response === null) {
            $result->status_code = 500;
            $result->status_message = $this->error ?: 'Unknown error';
            return $result;
        }

        $statusCode = $response->getStatusCode();
        $result->status_code = $statusCode;

        if ($statusCode >= 200 && $statusCode < 300) {
            $result->status_message = 'Success';
        } elseif ($statusCode >= 300 && $statusCode < 400) {
            $result->status_message = 'Redirect';
        } elseif ($statusCode >= 400 && $statusCode < 500) {
            $result->status_message = 'Client Error';
        } elseif ($statusCode >= 500 && $statusCode < 600) {
            $result->status_message = 'Server Error';
        } else {
            $result->status_message = 'Unexpected Status';
        }

        $result->response = (string) $response->getBody();
        return $result;
    }
}

        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->method);
        
        if ($this->method === 'POST' || $this->method === 'PUT') {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->request_body);

            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERPWD, $this->username . ':' . $this->password);

        if ($this->proxy) {

                fseek($this->read_stream, $this->seek_position);

            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILE, $this->read_stream);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILESIZE, $this->read_stream_size);
        }
        
        if ($this->write_stream) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_FILE, $this->write_stream);

            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, $this->registered_streaming_write_callback);
        }
        
        if ($this->registered_streaming_read_callback) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_READFUNCTION, $this->registered_streaming_read_callback);
        }
        
        if (!empty($this->request_headers)) {
            $headers = [];
            foreach ($this->request_headers as $key => $value) {
                $headers[] = "$key: $value";
            }
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }
        
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $this->useragent);
        
        if ($this->debug_mode) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_VERBOSE, true);
        }
        
        foreach ($this->curlopts as $opt => $value) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, $opt, $value);
        }
        
        return $this->curl_handle;
    }

    public function sendRequest($parse = false) {
        $this->prepRequest();
        $this->response = curl_exec($this->curl_handle);
        $this->response_info = curl_getinfo($this->curl_handle);

        }
        
        return $this->response;
    }

    public function processResponse($curl_handle, $response) {

            }
        }
        
        return $this->response_body;
    }

    }

    public function getResponseHeader($header = null) {
        if ($header) {
            return isset($this->response_headers[$header]) ? $this->response_headers[$header] : null;
        }
        return $this->response_headers;
    }

    public function getResponseBody() {
        return $this->response_body;
    }

    public function getResponseCode() {
        return $this->response_code;
    }
}

<?php
use GuzzleHttp\Client;

class SyncVideo {
    private $config;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(\Upyun\Config $config) {
        $this->config = $config;
        $this->client = new Client([
            'base_uri' => $config->getEndpoint(),
            'timeout' => $config->getTimeout(),
        ]);
    }

    public function process(array $params, string $path): array {
        $paramsJson = json_encode($params);
        $secret = $this->config->getSecretKey();
        $data = $paramsJson . $path;
        $signature = hash_hmac('sha256', $data, $secret, true);
        $signatureBase64 = base64_encode($signature);

        $response = $this->client->post($path, [
            'headers' => [
                'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
                'Authorization' => 'UPYUN ' . $signatureBase64,
            ],
            'body' => $paramsJson,
        ]);

        return json_decode((string) $response->getBody(), true);
    }
}

        $this->response = $response;
        return $this->response;

    public function send_request($parse = true) {
        $this->prep_request();
        $response = curl_exec($this->curl_handle);

    }

    public function get_response_body() {
        return $this->response_body;
    }

    public function get_response_code() {
        return $this->response_code;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using cURL, supporting various HTTP methods, streaming, authentication, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The RequestCore class provides a comprehensive HTTP client implementation using PHP's cURL extension. It supports standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD), handles request/response processing, streaming uploads/downloads, authentication, proxy configuration, and SSL verification.

        $this->read_stream_read += strlen($data);
        
        if ($this->registered_streaming_read_callback) {

        return $data;
    }

    public function streaming_write_callback($curl_handle, string $data) {
        $length = strlen($data);
        
        if ($this->write_stream) {
            fwrite($this->write_stream, $data);
        } elseif ($this->registered_streaming_write_callback) {
            $length = call_user_func($this->registered_streaming_write_callback, $curl_handle, $data);
        }
        
        return $length;
    }

    public function prep_request() {
        $this->curl_handle = curl_init();
        
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_URL, $this->request_url);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->method);
        
        $headers = [];
        foreach ($this->request_headers as $key => $value) {
            $headers[] = "$key: $value";
        }
        if (!isset($this->request_headers['User-Agent'])) {
            $headers[] = "User-Agent: " . $this->useragent;
        }
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        
        if ($this->method === 'POST' || $this->method === 'PUT') {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->request_body);
        }
        
        if ($this->username && $this->password) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERPWD, $this->username . ":" . $this->password);
        }
        
        if ($this->proxy) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy);
        }
        
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);

        } else {
